name: Brunwulf Free-Winter
role: Former Legionnaire, Advocate for Dunmer and the disenfranchised

aspects.high_concept: Open-Minded Nord War Veteran of Windhelm
aspects.trouble: Caught Between Skyrim's Traditions and His Conscience
other_aspects: Believes Skyrim Is Home to All Races

stunts: Voice of Reason: +2 to Rapport when trying to defuse racial tension or persuade Nords to be more accepting
Warrior of the Empire: +2 to Fight when battling Thalmor or defending others, owing to his Legion training
Streetwise Veteran: Once per scene, Brunwulf can use Empathy instead of Intimidate to quell a brewing conflict by invoking his reputation

equipment.armor: Worn Legionnaire Armor (kept from his service)
equipment.misc: Amulet of Talos (he honors all gods)

personality_notes.speaking_style: Calm, steady, with the gravelly tone of a seasoned soldier. He often sounds tired of conflict, but determined when discussing injustice.
motivations: Protect Windhelm's vulnerable citizens (Dunmer, Argonians) from abuse
End the civil war with minimal bloodshed
Prove that honor isn't exclusive to the Stormcloak cause
fears: Windhelm tearing itself apart from within due to hatred
Being seen as a traitor by his fellow Nords
That his efforts to help others will amount to nothing
quirks: Patrols the Gray Quarter on his own initiative to keep the peace
Offers a respectful nod to Dunmer elders and Argonian workers alike
Refuses to drink Nord mead out of protest when Dunmer friends aren't allowed in certain taverns

relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: Respects Ulfric's love for Skyrim but deeply disagrees with his prejudices; could become Jarl if Ulfric is deposed.
relationships.Galmar Stone-Fist: Galmar views him with suspicion as an 'Imperial lover'
relationships.Windhelm Dunmer Families: Trusted ally â€“ they know Brunwulf speaks for them when few Nords will
relationships.Imperial Legion: Former comrade-in-arms; still in touch with old Legion friends clandestinely

notes: Brunwulf Free-Winter fought for the Empire in the past (a veteran of the Great War) and now lives in Windhelm, quietly pushing back against Ulfric's more extreme nationalist policies. If the player aligns with the Empire or takes up causes to help the downtrodden, Brunwulf can become a valuable ally and even the new Jarl of Eastmarch should the Empire win. He represents a more inclusive vision for Skyrim.
